channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'There is no respect anymore' as ambulances come under attack in South Africa
item.description: That's what one paramedic says of the targeting of ambulance crews. Criminals are after phones and wallets along with medical equipment and drugs. We ride along with a Cape Town crew in a Red Zone.
item.content:encoded: That's what one paramedic says of the targeting of ambulance crews. Criminals are after phones and wallets along with medical equipment and drugs. We ride along with a Cape Town crew in a Red Zone.
item.dc:creator: Tommy Trenchard

item.title: An airstrike kills 20 in central Gaza as Israel's leaders air wartime divisions
item.description: An Israeli airstrike killed 20 people in central Gaza, mostly women and children, on Sunday, as fighting raged and Israel's leaders aired divisions over who should govern Gaza after the war.
item.content:encoded: An Israeli airstrike killed 20 people in central Gaza, mostly women and children, on Sunday, as fighting raged and Israel's leaders aired divisions over who should govern Gaza after the war.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The jawbone of washed-up whale in New Zealand was removed with chainsaw and stolen
item.description: The jawbone of a nearly 50-foot sperm whale that washed ashore in New Zealand's southernmost region has been removed. While the act is illegal, it's also considered disrespectful to the Māori people.
item.content:encoded: The jawbone of a nearly 50-foot sperm whale that washed ashore in New Zealand's southernmost region has been removed. While the act is illegal, it's also considered disrespectful to the Māori people.
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: US national security adviser and Saudi Arabia crown prince hold security deal talks
item.description: President Joe Biden's national security adviser met early Sunday with Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to discuss a wide-ranging security agreement between the countries.
item.content:encoded: President Joe Biden's national security adviser met early Sunday with Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to discuss a wide-ranging security agreement between the countries.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Usyk beats Fury to become first undisputed heavyweight boxing champion in 24 years
item.description: Ukrainian boxer Oleksandr Usyk became the world's first undisputed heavyweight boxing champion in 24 years by beating British fighter Tyson Fury in Saudi Arabia's Riyadh.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian boxer Oleksandr Usyk became the world's first undisputed heavyweight boxing champion in 24 years by beating British fighter Tyson Fury in Saudi Arabia's Riyadh.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: 'Magic United': Disneyland characters vote to unionize
item.description: Disneyland employees in California, including those who perform as characters from Mickey Mouse to Moana, have voted to unionize. The 1,700 workers will be represented by Actors' Equity Association.
item.content:encoded:
Disneyland employees in California, including those who perform as characters from Mickey Mouse to Moana, have voted to unionize. The 1,700 workers will be represented by Actors' Equity Association.

(Image credit: Handout)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Seize the Grey wins the Preakness, ending Mystik Dan's Triple Crown bid
item.description: Seize the Grey ended Kentucky Derby winner Mystik Dan's Triple Crown bid by going wire to wire to win the Preakness, giving trainer D. Wayne Lukas his seventh victory in the race.
item.content:encoded: Seize the Grey ended Kentucky Derby winner Mystik Dan's Triple Crown bid by going wire to wire to win the Preakness, giving trainer D. Wayne Lukas his seventh victory in the race.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A U.S. doctor in Gaza wants President Biden to know 'we are not safe'
item.description: Dr. Adam Hamawy is a former U.S. Army combat surgeon currently in Gaza. He said he's treating primarily civilians, rather than combatants: "mostly children, many women, many elderly."
item.content:encoded: Dr. Adam Hamawy is a former U.S. Army combat surgeon currently in Gaza. He said he's treating primarily civilians, rather than combatants: "mostly children, many women, many elderly."
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: Napkin securing Lionel Messi's first contract fetches nearly $1 million at auction
item.description: The handwritten restaurant napkin from the year 2000 was the starting point for an agreement between the then 13-year-old Messi and FC Barcelona.
item.content:encoded:
The handwritten restaurant napkin from the year 2000 was the starting point for an agreement between the then 13-year-old Messi and FC Barcelona.

(Image credit: Minas Panagiotakis)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A member of Israel's war cabinet says he'll quit if there is no plan to replace Hamas
item.description: The ultimatum by war cabinet member Benny Gantz reflects discontent among Israel's leadership about Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's handling of the Gaza war and his far-right political partners.
item.content:encoded:
The ultimatum by war cabinet member Benny Gantz reflects discontent among Israel's leadership about Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's handling of the Gaza war and his far-right political partners.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin
